pynami.schemas module¶

Schema classes corresponding to the NaMi data structure

Pretty much everything in this module depends on functions from the marshmallow module.

Todo

  • Include Bills

  • Include validation when neccessary

class NamiKonto(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Holds information about bank account and payment method of the member.

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

class NamiKontoSchema(only=(), exclude=(), prefix='', many=False, context=None, load_only=(), dump_only=(), partial=False)[source]¶

Bases: pynami.base.BaseSchema

Schema class for bank account and payment method information.

This Schema will is nested inside a MitgliedSchema and there should be no other use for it.

make_konto(data)[source]¶

Converts to main class after loading by making use of the post_load() decorator.

Parameters

data (dict) – Data dictionary

Returns

Main class for this Schema

Return type

NamiKonto

id_to_str(data)[source]¶

For some reason the NaMi gives the id of the payment details as an integer, but when you want to update a member it has be a string. Therefore this method converts incoming ids to a str object before loading them by making use of the pre_load() decorator.

Parameters

data (dict) – Data dictionary to be loaded

Returns

Corrected data dictionary

Return type

dict

double_dump(data)[source]¶

Incoming data sets are nicely formatted json strings which can be loaded easily into the Schema but when you update a Mitglied all payment details have to formatted into a json string and all attributes have to be in a certain order. To achieve this the post_dump() decorator is used.

Parameters

data (dict) – Already dumped data set

Returns

A json formatted string

Return type

str

opts = <marshmallow.schema.SchemaOpts object>¶
class NamiBaseadminIdField(default=<marshmallow.missing>, attribute=None, data_key=None, error=None, validate=None, required=False, allow_none=None, load_only=False, dump_only=False, missing=<marshmallow.missing>, error_messages=None, **metadata)[source]¶

Bases: marshmallow.fields.Field

For the general BaseadminSchema class the id of the actual entry can either by a str oder int so that there is the need for a custom Field.

class SearchMitglied(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class for a Mitglied which came up as a search result. Unfortunately there cannot be just one Mitglied class because the search results lack crucal imformation (e.g. payment details).

table_view()[source]¶

Prepare nicely formatted output

Returns

All data entries which are not in the blacklist

Return type

dict

tabulate(elements=None)[source]¶

Prepare ordered tabulated output

Parameters

Returns

Specified data entries

Return type

OrderedDict

get_mitglied(nami)[source]¶

Create a real Mitglied form the search result by getting the corresponding data set through the member id.

Parameters

nami (NaMi) – Main NaMi class

Returns

The Mitglied object corresponding to this search result.

Return type

Mitglied

class SearchMitgliedSchema(only=(), exclude=(), prefix='', many=False, context=None, load_only=(), dump_only=(), partial=False)[source]¶

Bases: pynami.base.BaseSchema

Schema class for SearchMitglied.

For some reason attribute naming in the NaMi is a bit inconsistent between a Mitglied which comes up as a search result and one that is addressed directly by its id.

make_user(data)[source]¶

Converts to main class after loading by making use of the post_load() decorator.

Main class for this Schema

Return type

SearchMitglied

opts = <marshmallow.schema.SchemaOpts object>¶
class Mitglied(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class representing a NaMi Mitglied

This class overwrites the __getattr__() and __setattr__() methods so that attributes of this class can be handled in a convinient way. It is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

Prepare nicely formatted output

Returns

All data entries which are not in the blacklist

Return type

dict

update(nami)[source]¶

Writes the possibly changed values to the NaMi

Parameters

nami (NaMi) – Main class for communication with the NaMi

Returns

The new Mitglied as it is returned by the NaMi

Return type

Mitglied

class MitgliedSchema(only=(), exclude=(), prefix='', many=False, context=None, load_only=(), dump_only=(), partial=False)[source]¶

Bases: pynami.base.BaseSchema

Schema class for a Mitglied

class Meta[source]¶

Bases: pynami.base.Meta

Extended marshmallow.Schema.Meta class for further configuration

ordered = True¶

This is nesseccary for the payment deatils to be dumped in the corrent order.

Type

bool

class Baseadmin(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base data class for all default values and their id mapping.

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

property type¶

Last part of the NaMi class structure which is stored in the representedClass attribute for all the default values.

Type

str

class BaseadminSchema(only=(), exclude=(), prefix='', many=False, context=None, load_only=(), dump_only=(), partial=False)[source]¶

Bases: pynami.base.BaseSchema

Schema class for the Baseadmin class

All the default values only consist of the same four attributes

class Notification(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class for notification like tier changes of a mitglied.

In the NaMi the notifications are displayed in the dashboard.

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

class HistoryEntry(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class for history entries

This contains information about an update of a Mitglied which is displayed on the NaMi dashbiard.

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

property type¶

class Stats(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class for basic statistical entries.

The information in this class is displayed in the NaMi dashboard in a pie chart.

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.

Bases: object

This class is intended to be instantiated by calling the load() method on a corresponding data dictionary.
